★★★★★ (yes, a full 10/10)

Jurassic Park isn’t just a movie; it’s the moment cinema swallowed the world whole and spat out pure magic.

In 1993 Steven Spielberg took a pretty good book, looked it dead in the eye, and said "hold my beer." What he delivered is the single most perfect blockbuster of the ’90s: 127 minutes that begin with a Brachiosaurus casually eating from the treetops and end with a T. rex roaring in triumph under pouring rain while the "When Dinosaurs Ruled the Earth" banner flutters to the ground. In between you get everything: childlike wonder (Sam Neill’s face the first time he sees a living dinosaur is still the most beautiful shot in blockbuster history), unbearable tension (the kitchen raptor sequence remains the scariest thing ever filmed with kids in it), and lines tattooed into pop-culture DNA ("Life finds a way," "Hold on to your butts," "Clever girl").

The ILM and Stan Winston effects were so revolutionary they still look flawless 32 years later (that T. rex breakout in the rain is more real than half of today’s CGI). John Williams drops one of his three or four greatest scores ever (the main theme is literally the definition of "epic"). And the cast is pure gold: Sam Neill and Laura Dern with real-couple chemistry, Jeff Goldblum being the sexy chaos we all secretly wanted to be, Richard Attenborough as the dreamy mad-grandpa we all wished we had, and those kids (Ariana Richards and Joseph Mazzello) who never annoy and make you genuinely terrified when the raptors hunt them.

Jurassic Park didn’t age. We aged around it. It’s the movie that made an entire generation want to be paleontologists for a week… and then rewatch it a thousand more times.

Five stars feels too small. This is the absolute pinnacle of entertainment cinema.  
10/10. Welcome… to Jurassic Park. Thank you for changing everything forever. 🦖🌿⚡❤️

I hadn't watched this movie in a very, very long time. I decided to rewatch it to kick off watching he entire series, and I was honestly blown away and impressed. This film still holds up to this day, even in 2025. I remember as a kid falling in love with dinosaurs, and many of my friends did too, all because of this movie. I especially remember the Jurassic Park fighting game, where you were dinosaurs fighting each other. This is peak cinema.
I LOVE T-REX !!!!!!!!

I had seen bits and pieces but (on our weekly movie wheel) it won and I sat down to watch it front to back - it left me excited and full of thoughts like all of my favorite childhood movies, and I absolutely understood all of the hype. Five stars, that’s cinema baybee
This is my favorite movie. Love the science, love the acting. Stands on its own, but love the book too.
Best movie of all time, nuff said

Outside of the ridiculous “Deus Ex Machina” at the end and a few editing mistakes, this movie is a masterpiece; holds up to this day. With likable characters, great pacing, beautiful animatronics and computer effects, and stellar cinematography and visual storytelling, mainly due to the brilliant Steven Spielberg at the helm. Many of the sequels mainly suffer, from not only a lackluster script but a mundane sense of direction as well; not taking advantage of the movie’s stars, the dinosaurs and their potential. Not this movie though; the dinosaurs, for their minimal screen time; under 15 minutes, steal the show whenever they appear. Not to mention the mesmerizing score by John Williams and his seamless ability to swiftly transition from adventurous, to fantastical, to mysterious, to thrilling, to child-like amazement, to terrifying! All of which consistently entertaining and not boring. The acting from everybody is great, making the most out of their respective personalities, particularly Jeff Goldblum as Ian Malcolm. Even the kids are good; not being incessantly annoying but annoying in a way that’s believable. What ties it all together is the heart of the movie, the central themes of genetic engineering and chaos theory, and humane morals regarding man’s hubris; going for man’s warmness regarding family over an ambitious sense of confidence over nature.
jurassic park is the best action movie ever it hads lot action in the movie the greatest 1993 film ever made a billion dollars at the box office ever

Critics Consensus:
“An awe-inspiring adventure that redefined blockbuster filmmaking, Jurassic Park remains a towering achievement in both storytelling and special effects.”

Steven Spielberg’s Jurassic Park roars to life with jaw-dropping visuals, unforgettable tension, and a sense of wonder that few films have matched since. From the first glimpse of a towering Brachiosaurus to the electrifying raptor chase in the kitchen, every frame pulses with cinematic magic.

The combination of John Williams’ iconic score, groundbreaking animatronics, and early CGI creates an experience that feels as thrilling today as it did in 1993. Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum anchor the spectacle with performances that balance scientific curiosity, human vulnerability, and sardonic wit.

More than just a monster movie, Jurassic Park is a meditation on ambition, chaos, and the limits of human control—wrapped in one of the most exhilarating adventures ever put on screen.

Verdict:
A cinematic landmark that proves science and storytelling can be a perfect genetic match. Jurassic Park earns every one of its five stars.
This movie was so amazing. It’s hard not to give it five stars, so I think I will. Movies just aren’t built like this anymore, and it would be amazing if we went back to that.
This is the greatest movie of all time. Period.
The OG Dinosaur film that rocked audiences, and still holds up today. Better than everything that came after it.
It’s a masterpiece. That’s all I need to say. If you want comedy mixed with a couple jumpscares, watch this!
It is just a amazing movie overall with the technology they had back in the 90’s they did very well with it!
Great film. Great cast, great plot, just perfect.

If you love dinosaurs, then this is that movie. Steven Spielbergs blockbuster hit and masterpiece is when scientist brings DINOSAURS BACK TO LIFE! And then all just hell breaks loose. If you haven't seen it you have no idea what you're missing.
